title: Accurate weather forecasting soon: Meteorology Department
byline: The Meteorology Department will be able to provide more accurate weather forecasts from 2026, following the installation of two Doppler radar systems by the end of this year.

title: Shortage of meteorologists hits weather department
byline: The Meteorology Department lacks a sufficient number of duty meteorologists, Deputy Director of Forecasting and Early Warning M.M.P. Mendis said.

title: CR host first rugby encounter under lights
byline: CR and FC will make history with their first-ever floodlight rugby match at Longden Place today when they play with their traditional rivals Havelock Sports Club. The kick-off is at 6.30 p.m.

title: CID arrests couple at BIA over multi-billion rupee pyramid scheme
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) arrested a 52-year-old man, Dhammika Kumara Ranasinghe, who returned from Malaysia this morning, at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), for his involvement in defrauding over Rs. 10 billion through a pyramid scam.

title: Over 3,000 driving licenses suspended due to various illegal activities: DMT
byline: A total of 3,249 driving licenses have been suspended since January this year due to various illegal activities committed by motorists, Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) Commissioner General Nishantha Anuruddha Weerasingha said.

title: Schools close for elections from Wednesday, reopen on Nov. 18
byline: The Education Ministry announced that all schools will close from November 13 in preparation for the parliamentary elections scheduled for the following day (November 14).

title: Probe reveals Lohan’s use of unregistered luxury car since 2020
byline: Investigations into the recovery of an illegally assembled, unregistered luxury car from the home of former State Minister Lohan Ratwatte’s wife in Mirihana have revealed that Ratwatte had been using the vehicle since 2020 with a fake number plate.

title: Ask Grandfather if you don’t know how to manage finances: Ranil
byline: Taking a swipe at the name he is often referred to by some of his opponents, former President Ranil Wickremesinghe yesterday said the government hierarchy should seek advice from the ’grandfather’ if they do not know how to handle government finances.

title: Supreme Court halts attempt to release illegally held elephants to suspects
byline: The Supreme Court yesterday issued several interim orders, including staying and suspending all proceedings in the impugned Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court case, where an order to release elephants to suspects in those proceedings, had been made by the Magistrate.

title: October tea sale averages slide
byline: Sri Lanka’s national tea sales average for October declined to Rs. 1,172.15 (US$ 4.02) per kilogram, down by Rs. 35.84 and US$ 0.02 compared with September’s Rs. 1,207.99 (US$ 4.04), according to data from the Sri Lanka Tea Board.

title: Korea steps in with US$ 10.2mn to help Sri Lanka tackle trash
byline: The Government of Korea has granted US$ 10.20 million to Sri Lanka to improve solid waste management practices in the Uva and Northern provinces.

title: Investigations reveal defective brakes caused fatal bus crash in Badulla
byline: Motor Vehicle Examiners of the Department of Motor Traffic, who examined the bus involved in the recent fatal bus accident at Ambagahaoya on Badulla – Mahiyangana on November 01, have reported that the accident was due to defective brakes. They examined the wreckage on Thursday (07) at Badulla Police ground.

title: Motor Traffic Department closes for two days for election
byline: The Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) has decided to close its Narahenpita Head Office on Wednesday, November 13 and Thursday, November 14 due to the General Elections.

title: Police constable arrested for burglary
byline: A police constable who burgled a house in Dehiwala and took away property including foreign currency, gold jewellery and electrical appliances was arrested yesterday by the Dehiwala police.

title: West Indies quick handed suspension for on-field incident
byline: A two-match ban for the pace bowler for his part in an on-field incident against England.

title: Nissan to lay off thousands of workers as sales drop
byline: Nissan has said it will lay off thousands of workers as it slashes global production to tackle a drop in sales in China and the US.

title: Lady principal arrested over bribery in Ragama
byline: Officials of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption arrested a female principal of a primary school in Ragama for allegedly demanding a bribe of Rs. 150,000.

title: CID arrests couple at BIA over multi-billion rupee pyramid scam
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) arrested a 52-year-old man, Dhammika Kumara Ranasinghe, who returned from Malaysia this morning, at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), for his involvement in defrauding over Rs. 10 billion through a pyramid scam.

title: Sri Lanka mulls joining BRICS-founded New Development Bank
byline: The government is considering obtaining the membership of the New Development Bank (NDB), a multilateral development bank established by the BRICS states, after failing to obtain BRICS membership due its decision not to grant new membership, Minister Vijitha Herath said yesterday.

title: Customs, CTC destroy Rs. 390 Mn worth illicit fags seized from BIA
byline: A large stock of illicit cigarettes seized by the Sri Lanka Customs from the airport, which was worth over Rs. 390 million was destroyed at the Western Power Waste-to-Energy Power Plant in Kerawalapitiya this week.

title: Sri Lanka prepare for rain-soaked T20 showdown with New Zealand
byline: Sri Lanka hope to maintain their purple patch at home with a two-match Twenty20 series against New Zealand starting Saturday -- but rains may force the hosts to keep their formidable spin attack on standby.

title: NMRA clarifies misinformation on pharmacy license rejections
byline: In response to recent reports suggesting a potential wave of pharmacy closures across Sri Lanka due to alleged rejections of license renewal applications, the National Medicines Regulatory Authority (NMRA) clarified that these reports are inaccurate.

title: Complaints on election law violations surpass 2,000
byline: A total of 149 fresh complaints related to the upcoming General Elections were received, pushing the total number of complaints to over 2,000.
